Class WarGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • WarGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WarGameInterface

    public class WarGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements WarGameInterface

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WarGame()
      Constructor for starting a new game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WarGame

        public WarGame()
        Constructor for starting a new game. Makes a new deck, shuffles it, deals one half to each player.

    • Method Detail

      • dealHand

        public void dealHand(Deck inputDeck)
        Loops 26 times (one half of a 52 card deck) queueing one card at a time to each player's hand. The cards are already shuffled.
        Specified by:
        dealHand in interface WarGameInterface
        Parameters:
        inputDeck, - the deck that is instantiated in the WarGame object constructor.

      • battle

        public char battle(Card playerCard,
          Card computerCard)
        Draws one card from each players hand, then compares the two. Only the rank is considered. Whoever wins gets both cards added to their hand (bottom of the queue). If it is a war then no cards are added to either hand, instead the main() method of the game program should call the war() method.
        Specified by:
        battle in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        V if player beats the computer (victory) L if player loses to computer W if there is a match (WAR!)

      • war

        public void war(Card playerCard,
       Card computerCard)
        The highlight of this boring pseudogame! Two cards are dequeued from each hand (player and computer) but only the second card is shown. The second card is used to determine the winner of the war by calling the battle() method. If the two War cards are again the same rank, then there is a recursive call to the war() method again.
        Specified by:
        war in interface WarGameInterface
        Parameters:
        playerCard - Original player card which started the war.
        computerCard - Original computer card which started the war.

      • playerDraw

        public Card playerDraw()
        Returns the first card in the players hand. Because the Card objects are in a queue, they must be cast as Card objects, otherwise they will be dequeued as superclass "Object" objects. If there are no cards remaining the the player's hand (queue) then a call to the gameOver() method is made.
        Specified by:
        playerDraw in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        The top card of the player's hand.

      • computerDraw

        public Card computerDraw()
        Returns the first card in the computers hand. Because the Card objects are in a queue, they must be cast as Card objects, otherwise they will be dequeued as superclass "Object" objects. If there are no cards remaining the the computer's hand (queue) then a call to the gameOver() method is made.
        Specified by:
        computerDraw in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        The top card of the computer's hand.

      • getPlayersCardsRemaining

        public java.lang.Integer getPlayersCardsRemaining()
        Getter so that the main() method can get access to the remaining cards in each persons (or computers) hand.
        Specified by:
        getPlayersCardsRemaining in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        number of cards left in the player's hand.

      • getComputersCardsRemaining

        public java.lang.Integer getComputersCardsRemaining()
        Getter so that the main() method can get access to the remaining cards in each persons (or computers) hand.
        Specified by:
        getComputersCardsRemaining in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        number of cards left in the computer's hand.

      • getWarPlayerCard

        public java.lang.String getWarPlayerCard()
        Keeps track of the car which is played during war (the second face up card, the first being the one which started the war) by the player. This allows for the GUI implementation to retrieve the image path.
        Specified by:
        getWarPlayerCard in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        the image path corresponding to the card played by the player during war.

      • getWarComputerCard

        public java.lang.String getWarComputerCard()
        Keeps track of the car which is played during war (the second face up card, the first being the one which started the war) by the computer. This allows for the GUI implementation to retrieve the image path.
        Specified by:
        getWarComputerCard in interface WarGameInterface
        Returns:
        the image path corresponding to the card played by the computer during war.

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver(java.lang.String s)
        This method prints a string telling the player the outcome of the game, it is called internally if either the player or the computer runs out of cards in their hand. A message is given to the user, and then the program is exited.
        Specified by:
        gameOver in interface WarGameInterface
        Parameters:
        s - is a string which holds the name of the player who has run out of cards.
